text.section: There is a Board of Trustees of the Exchange.

The Board consists of the following members:
the Secretary of Health and Mental Hygiene;
the Commissioner;
the Executive Director of the Maryland Health Care Commission; and
the following members appointed by the Governor, with the advice and consent of the Senate:
three members who:
three members who have demonstrated knowledge and expertise in at least two of the following areas:

In making appointments of members under subsection (b)(4) of this section, the Governor shall assure that:
the Board's composition reflects a diversity of expertise;
the Board's composition reflects the gender, racial, and ethnic diversity of the State; and
the geographic areas of the State are represented.

section.section:
A member of the Board or of the staff of the Exchange, while serving on the Board or the staff, may not have an affiliation with:
a carrier, an insurance producer, a third-party administrator, a managed care organization, or any other person contracting directly with the Exchange;
a trade association of carriers, insurance producers, third-party administrators, or managed care organizations; or
any other association of entities in a position to contract directly with the Exchange.
The term of a member appointed by the Governor is 4 years.
The terms of members appointed by the Governor are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on June 1, 2011.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: An appointed member of the Board may not serve more than two consecutive full terms.
The Governor shall designate a chair of the Board.

section.section: The Board shall determine the times, places, and frequency of its meetings.
Five members of the Board constitute a quorum.
Action by the Board requires the affirmative vote of at least five members.

text.section: A member of the Board is entitled to reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.

A member shall:
meet the requirements of this title, the Affordable Care Act, and all applicable State and federal laws and regulations;
serve the public interest of the individuals and qualified employers seeking health care coverage through the Exchange; and
ensure the sound operation and fiscal solvency of the Exchange.

A member of the Board shall perform the member's duties:
in good faith;
in the manner the member reasonably believes to be in the best interests of the Exchange; and
without intentional or reckless disregard of the care an ordinarily prudent person in a like position would use under similar circumstances.
A member of the Board who performs the member's duties in accordance with the standard provided in subsection (k) of this section may not be liable personally for actions taken as a member.
A member of the Board may be removed for incompetence, misconduct, or failure to perform the duties of the position.

section.section: A member of the Board shall be subject to the State Ethics Law, Title 15, Subtitles 1 through 7 of the State Government Article.

In addition to the disclosure required under Title 15, Subtitle 6 of the State Government Article, a member of the Board shall disclose to the Board and to the public any relationship not addressed in the required financial disclosure that the member has with a carrier, insurance producer, third-party administrator, managed care organization, or other entity in an industry involved in matters likely to come before the Board.
